fields.name: requestor
fields.comment: REQUIRED. The requestor header contains detailed information about who is calling the API. It can include information such as channel, organization, sales unit or workstation id and be used to configure e.g. the fare range provided to the caller. The content of the string is part of a bilateral contract by the two parties and not standardized by OSDM. It is recommend to encrypt the information transferred.

fields.name: acceptLanguage
fields.comment: Describes the set of natural languages that are preferred for localized text in the response to the request (see RFC2616-sec14.4). Supporting English (en) is a must.

fields.name: traceparent
fields.comment: The traceparent header describes the position of the incoming request in its trace graph in a portable, fixed-length format. Its design focuses on fast parsing. Every tracing tool MUST properly set traceparent even when it only relies on vendor-specific information in tracestate (see W3C Trace Context).

fields.name: tracestate
fields.comment: The tracestate extends traceparent with vendor-specific data represented by a set of name/value pairs. Storing information in tracestate is optional (see W3C Trace Context).
